author: @phnv
content:
Ok. "free" , in this context, obviously means nobody had to pay a ticket to watch the concert. The city and State government, along with a few private companies obviously paid for a lot - the structure, safety and organization and Madonnas group cache - including technicians and performers . It must be understood, however that Rio is a major touristic city and tourism here plays an immense role in the local economy. Last New Years Eve tourism peaked again for the first time after pandemics , which brought us a record in tourism revenue; It was a hint that it was time to get back on investing in big events that could bring tourists back to the city; It probably worked, since many people used the Labour day holiday to stay longer, also the thursday before the show hotels scored 90% occupation and airbnb searches for places in Rio peaked over 1000% - something rare out of Carnival and New Years Eve. There were people from all over Brazil and South America.

So, TLDR, from big companies to small local shops, there was an immense amount of money and jobs spinning from this investment - definitely not a waste of money. It's not like some small town in the middle of nowhere gave a banquet for nobody like many make it sound. Last but not least, what is happening in RS state is very unfortunate but there is absolutely nothing anyone can do in Rio to prevent floods down south.

The city and State government, along with a few private companies obviously paid for a lot - the structure, safety and organization and Madonnas group cache - including technicians and performers . It must be understood, however  that Rio is a major touristic city and tourism here plays an immense role in the local economy. Last New Years Eve tourism peaked again for the first time after pandemics , which brought us a record in tourism revenue; It was a hint that it was time to get back on investing in big events that could bring tourists back to the city; It probably worked,  since many people used the Labour day holiday to stay longer, also the thursday before the show hotels scored 90% occupation and airbnb searches for places in Rio peaked over 1000% - something rare out of Carnival and New Years Eve.
